alert.note: Alert for Scott (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 17 at 3:44PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Scott County through 530 PM EDT... At 444 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles northwest of Helenwood, or 7 miles west of Oneida, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Oneida, Winfield, Ketchen, Honey Creek State Park and Big South Fork National Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
